humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " black " to " accounting ", the original meaning is small black marks. "Shuowen": "Xiaohei also. From the black, occupy the sound." "Book of Jin‧ Wenyuan Biography‧ Yuan Hong": "It is like Baigui, the quality is dust-free."

" Point " can mean tarnish and insult. "Selected Works‧ Sima Qian (Reported by Ren Shaoqing)": "Sufficient to laugh and point your ears." Li Shan's note: "Point, shame."

" Point " also means subtract. "Erya·Shiqi": "The point of extinction is the point." Guo Pu's note: "The point is the extinction of characters by pen."

" Dot " also means adding some breaks. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Shishuo Xinyu·Literature": "The rest of the articles, or fixed-point sentences."

" Dot " also means embellishment. He Yan of the Three Kingdoms "Jingfu Palace Fu": "Silver and yellow for dots, Langgan for shining."

" Point " can mean adding a point to indicate. Jin Guo's "Xuan Zhong Ji": "Today, children's clothes don't want to show up at night. For this reason, they love to put blood on their clothes as their ambition, that is, take children."

Liquid droplets are also called " dots ". Song Luyou "Work in the Rain": "The sound of the wind is like a turbulent wave, and the raindrops are like a stubble."

" Point " also refers to check points . Tang Wangjian "Song Yi Song": "I used to order clothes at the beginning of October and write to Lang Xiangying CIMC."

" Point " also refers to pointing. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 31: "Baoyu listened and knew it was his words the day before yesterday."

" Point " can also be used as a quantifier to indicate a small amount or an infinite amount. Tang Hanyu's "Gaojun Immortal Inscription": "Round and Wanzhong, a bit of ink."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " black " to " accounting ", the original meaning is small black marks.
humanum_full_description:
從「黑」，「占」聲，本義為細小黑色斑痕。《說文》：「小黑也。从黑，占聲。」《晉書‧文苑傳‧袁宏》：「如彼白珪，質無塵點。」

　　「點」可表示玷污、侮辱。《文選‧司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉》：「適足以見笑而自點耳。」李善注：「點，辱也。」

　　「點」還表示減去。《爾雅‧釋器》：「滅謂之點。」郭璞注：「以筆滅字為點。」

　　「點」也表示加點斷句。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧文學》：「其餘眾篇，或定點文句而已。」

　　「點」亦表示點綴。三國魏何晏〈景福殿賦〉：「點以銀黃，爍以琅玕。」

　　「點」可指加點標明。晉郭氏《玄中記》：「今時小兒之衣不欲夜露者，為此物愛以血點其衣為誌，即取小兒也。」

　　液體小滴也稱為「點」。宋陸游〈雨中作〉：「風聲如翻濤，雨點如撒菽。」

　　「點」亦指查點。唐王建〈送衣曲〉：「舊來十月初點衣，與郎著向營中集。」

　　「點」還指指點。《紅樓夢》第31回：「寶玉聽了，知道是點他前日的話。」

　　「點」還可用作量詞，表示少量或不定量。唐韓愈〈高君仙硯銘〉：「稜而宛中，有點墨跡。」
humanum_short_description: 從「黑」，「占」聲，本義為細小黑色斑痕。

HSK 3: 典
點點RS
点点 		㸃 dot, speck, spot, point, degree
  • observing 占 black 黑 spots 点
  • ⓢ observing 占 spots after burning 灬 something
 要; 班
(Simplified: 点)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 面
Pictophonetic: 占 indicates the sound; 黑 (black) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 黑 [ hēi ] black; dark; evil, sinister
    • 占 [ zhàn ] to divine; to observe; to versify
①細小的痕跡或物體：點滴。斑點。點子(ａ．液體的小滴，如“水點點”；b．小的痕跡，如“油點點”；c．打擊樂器演奏時的節拍，如“鼓點點”；d．主意，辦法，如“請大家出點點”；e．最能說明問題的關鍵地方，如“話沒有說到點點上”)。
②幾何學上指沒有長、寬、厚而只有位置的幾何圖形；兩條線相交處或線段的兩端。
③數學上表示小數部分開始的符號(．)，稱“小數點”，如“231.4”。
④量詞，用於小的或少的：兩三點雨。幾點淚水。
⑤一定的位置或限度：地點。起點。極點。居民點。
⑥項，部分，方面：優點。要點。特點。
⑦漢字筆形之一(丶)：點畫。三點水。
⑧加上點子，引申爲修飾：標點。評點。點綴。畫龍點睛。
⑨使一點一滴地落下或發出：點種。點射(自動武器有間歇的射擊)。點眼藥。
⑩一落一起或一觸即離的動作：點頭。點穴。
⑾引火：點火(亦喻挑起是非，製造事端)。
⑿查對：點數。點名。點卯(舊時稱官衙、軍伍卯時開始辦公、操練，官員查點人數)。
⒀指定，選派：點菜。點將(jiàng)。聽衆點播。
⒁指示，啓發：指點。點撥。
⒂計時的單位：更點(分爲五更，一更又分五點)。三更三點。鐘點。
⒃污：點污。點辱(使受污辱)。
⒄指正餐以外的暫時充飢，亦指糕餅一類的食物：點心(“心”讀輕聲)。點補(喫少量的食品解餓。“補”讀輕聲)。
⒅同“踮”。
(Simplified: 点)

Kanshudo mnemonic:you occupy (占 ) the black (黑) spot
Chinese: The fortune teller can spot blackness in anyone's soul.
Meaning: spot
Hanzi: 点
Story: The fortune teller was burned by flames on the spot because she was accused of being a witch.
Kind: traditional

從「 黑 」，「 占 」聲，本義為細小黑色斑痕。《說文》：「小黑也。从黑，占聲。」《晉書‧文苑傳‧袁宏》：「如彼白珪，質無塵點。」 「 點 」可表示玷污、侮辱。《文選‧司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉》：「適足以見笑而自點耳。」李善注：「點，辱也。」 「 點 」還表示減去。《爾雅‧釋器》：「滅謂之點。」郭璞注：「以筆滅字為點。」 「 點 」也表示加點斷句。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧文學》：「其餘眾篇，或定點文句而已。」 「 點 」亦表示點綴。三國魏何晏〈景福殿賦〉：「點以銀黃，爍以琅玕。」 「 點 」可指加點標明。晉郭氏《玄中記》：「今時小兒之衣不欲夜露者，為此物愛以血點其衣為誌，即取小兒也。」 液體小滴也稱為「 點 」。宋陸游〈雨中作〉：「風聲如翻濤，雨點如撒菽。」 「 點 」亦指查點。唐王建〈送衣曲〉：「舊來十月初點衣，與郎著向營中集。」 「 點 」還指指點。《紅樓夢》第31回：「寶玉聽了，知道是點他前日的話。」 「 點 」還可用作量詞，表示少量或不定量。唐韓愈〈高君仙硯銘〉：「稜而宛中，有點墨跡。」
From the sound of " black" to " accounting", the original meaning is small black marks. "Shuowen": "Xiaohei also. From the black, occupy the sound." "Book of Jin‧ Wenyuan Biography‧ Yuan Hong": "It is like Baigui, the quality is dust-free." " Point" can mean tarnish and insult. "Selected Works‧ Sima Qian (Reported by Ren Shaoqing)": "Sufficient to laugh and point your ears." Li Shan's note: "Point, shame." " Point" also means subtract. "Erya·Shiqi": "The point of extinction is the point." Guo Pu's note: "The point is the extinction of characters by pen." " Dot" also means adding some breaks. Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Shishuo Xinyu·Literature": "The rest of the articles, or fixed-point sentences." " Dot" also means embellishment. He Yan of the Three Kingdoms "Jingfu Palace Fu": "Silver and yellow for dots, Langgan for shining." " Point" can mean adding a point to indicate. Jin Guo's "Xuan Zhong Ji": "Today, children's clothes don't want to show up at night. For this reason, they love to put blood on their clothes as their ambition, that is, take children." Liquid droplets are also called " dots". Song Luyou "Work in the Rain": "The sound of the wind is like a turbulent wave, and the raindrops are like a stubble." " Point" also refers to check points. Tang Wangjian "Song Yi Song": "I used to order clothes at the beginning of October and write to Lang Xiangying CIMC." " Point" also refers to pointing. "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 31: "Baoyu listened and knew it was his words the day before yesterday." " Point" can also be used as a quantifier to indicate a small amount or an infinite amount. Tang Hanyu's "Gaojun Immortal Inscription": "Round and Wanzhong, a bit of ink."

點字的基本解释

點
diǎn
见“点”。

點字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diǎn］
［《廣韻》多忝切，上忝，端。］
亦作“奌1”。“点1”的繁体字。
(1)小黑点。亦指小的痕迹。
(2)辱；污。
(3)涂抹、灭去。
(4)汉字的一种笔画。即“丶”。
(5)加点断句。
(6)点缀。
(7)中；着。
(8)加点标明。
(9)评论。参见“嗤點”、“指點”。
(10)液体小滴。
(11)古代夜间的计时单位。一夜分五更，一更分五点。
(12)现代计时单位。一昼夜分为二十四点。
(13)滴注，下落。
(14)检验；查点。
(15)指点；启示。
(16)征调。
(17)蘸。
(18)乐器名。一种悬空敲击的乐器。形如小铜鼓，中间隆起，两边有孔系绳。用于报时，或用于合乐，击之以显节拍。
(19)乐器名。一种特制响器，两端作云状，名为云板，也称点。旧时邸宅、官署以击点为集众报事的信号。
(20)节奏，节拍。
(21)燃点。
(22)点化。
(23)围棋术语。点眼。
(24)冲；泡。
(25)委放；选授。

點字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【黑字部】　點； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1519第28
【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】?多忝切，音玷。【說文】小黑也。　又【正韻】點注也。【爾雅·釋器】滅謂之點。【註】以筆滅字爲點。又【玉篇】檢點也。　又【廣韻】點畫。　又【正韻】更點。　又【廣雅】污也。【太史公報任安書】適足以見笑而自點耳。　又【集韻】之廉切，音詹。人名。魯有豐點，齊有鮑點。　又【集韻】丁賀切，音哆。草葉壞也。【齊民要術】故墟種麻，有點葉夭折之患。　又【集韻】都念切，音店。亦汙也。【束皙·白華詩】鮮侔晨葩，莫之點辱。

考證：〔【太史公報任安書】適足以發笑而自點耳。〕　謹照原文發笑改見笑。

暂无。

point
Basic explanation of words
point
diǎn
See "point".
point
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［diǎn］
["Guangyun" is very cut, up and down. ]
Also known as "奌1". Traditional characters of "点1".
(1) Little black dots. Also refers to small traces.
(2) Humiliation; pollution.
(3) Smear and wipe off.
(4) A stroke of Chinese characters. That is, "Dian".
(5) Add some sentence breaks.
(6) Embellishment.
(7) In; With.
(8) Add points to indicate.
(9) Comments. See "chi point", "point to point".
(10) Liquid droplets.
(11) The unit of time at night in ancient times. One night is divided into five shifts, and one shift is divided into five points.
(12) Modern time unit. A day and a night are divided into twenty-four points.
(13) Drip, drop.
(14) Inspection; check points.
(15) Pointing; Enlightenment.
(16) Requisition.
(17) Dip.
(18) The name of the instrument. A percussion instrument in the air. It is shaped like a small bronze drum with a bulge in the middle and a tether with holes on both sides. Used for telling the time, or for playing together, hit it to show the beat.
(19) The name of the instrument. A special sound damping device with a cloud shape at both ends, called a cloud board, also called a dot. The old mansions and government offices used hit points as a signal to gather reports.
(20) Rhythm, beat.
(21) Burning point.
(22) Enlightenment.
(23) Go terms. Nod.
(24) Brew; bubble.
(25) Delegate; elect.
point
